lyrics.stanza: Lord, I've been waiting for Your coming, Waiting so long. Lord, now my restless wait seems endless, Continually prolonged. I deeply long to see Your visage, Your voice to hear. I hope for fellowship much closer, Than what today is here.
Must I still wait several more years; Wander yet some more? Rememb'ring You still shed yet more tears? Before You come back, Lord?

How can the widow put off mourning, Her love not miss? Not seeing him can she stop weeping And no more reminisce? How can the bride before her wedding Not lovesick be? Will not that joyful day's postponing Make her sigh constantly?

Age after age the church has waited— Thousands of years; Age after age endures in waiting, But You are not yet here. I've also waited many long years Since I was young. Friends one by one have aged and died, Lord, But You have not yet come.

Through years of trials, Lord, I've waited— I'm tired now. Slowly it's easier to murmer, And to forget my vow. So, Lord, I pray, delay no longer. Please come soon, Lord! Already I've endured till today Can I still suffer more?

Lord, note my prolonged wait; it's so hard To continue. If you cannot come back in time then Take me, Lord, unto You. This long, long time You hide Your glory Remain above; Already some would sneer and mock me Saying You will not come.

For all my heart's deep pain and suff'ring, No comfort now. There's no one that could help me now, Lord, For You're not here with me. Until You come, lead me to glory, Nothing is sweet. All this along the way I've suffered I'll forget when we meet.
